clinical_study.brief_title: Demonstration of Near Zero Antibiotic Prescribing for Acute Bronchitis
clinical_study.official_title: Demonstration of Near Zero Antibiotic Prescribing for Acute Bronchitis

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: Studies show, guidelines state, and performance measures assert that antibiotic prescribing for uncomplicated acute bronchitis is inappropriate. However, clinicians prescribe antimicrobials in over 60% of the 22.5 million acute bronchitis visits in the United States each year. Previous successful interventions have only reduced the antimicrobial prescribing rate to 40% or 50%. It is unknown if the antimicrobial prescribing rate for acute bronchitis can be brought to near zero percent in actual practice while maintaining patient safety and satisfaction. The goal of this study is to develop an Electronic Health Record (EHR)-integrated algorithm for the diagnosis and treatment of adults with acute bronchitis with a goal of reducing the antibiotic prescribing rate to near zero percent.

detailed_description.textblock: We will use a multi-modal implementation - including computerized decision support, reporting tools, and clinician feedback - and quality improvement techniques to ensure adherence to the algorithm and reduce the antimicrobial prescribing rate to near zero percent. The duration of the intervention will be 4 years.

primary_outcome.description: The antibiotic prescribing rate for patients with acute bronchitis

secondary_outcome.measure: The capture and description of the components that had the greatest effect on the antimicrobial prescribing rate

arm_group.description: Single arm in the study of doctors receiving feedback about their antibiotic prescribing rate for acute bronchitis.

intervention.intervention_name: Demonstration of near zero antibiotic prescribing for patients with acute bronchitis
intervention.description: A controlled, continuously-monitored, implementation of an EHR-integrated diagnosis and treatment algorithm for acute bronchitis in a large, diverse primary care practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- first visit in 30 days, age 18-64, has a cough of less than 3 weeks duration
Exclusion Criteria:
- infiltrate on chest x-ray, has chronic lung disease
